title: Chicken Parm Stuffed Peppers
ingredients: 2 red or yellow medium bell peppers
directions: THE NIGHT BEFORE. Season chicken. Set chicken to cook in slow cooker with chicken stock.
Shred the cooked chicken in a bowl.
Add stock to shredded chicken until it no longer tastes dry.
Heat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a 13x9 pan with butter or non-stick spray.
Cut the peppers in half length wise and remove the seeds and membranes. Boil the peppers for two minutes then drain.
In a medium bowl, mix the chicken, 1/2 cup tomato sauce and 1/2 cup mozzarella.
Place peppers cutside up in a baking dish. Stuff with the chicken mixture. Top with the remaining sauce and mozzarella.
In a small bowl, mix the bread crumbs, parm, and olive oil. Sprinkle on top of peppers.
Cover tightly with foil sprayed with cooking spray and bake 15 minutes.
Remove foil and bake an additional 25 - 30 minutes until the peppers are tender.
